meanings.definition: To set or establish boundaries or limits.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a ruler to demarcate the border of the map.
meanings.sent2: It is important to demarcate personal space in a crowded room.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully demarcated their imaginary kingdoms with pillows.
meanings.sent4: The artist's use of color demarcated the different sections of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The fence helped demarcate the property line clearly.

meanings.sent1: The color contrast helped demarcate the different sections of the document.
meanings.sent2: The referee had to demarcate the out-of-bounds area on the field.
meanings.sent3: The detective was able to demarcate the real clues from the distractions.
meanings.sent4: Her unique style of writing demarcated her work from that of other authors.
meanings.sent5: The use of bold font helped demarcate the important information.
